verse: राधाकृष्णयोरेकमासनम् । एका बुद्धिः । एकं मनः । एकं ज्ञानम् । एक आत्मा । एकं पदम् । एका आकृतिः । एकं ब्रह्म । तस्य समं अत एव द्वयोर्न भेदः कालमायागुणातीतत्वात

terms.तस्य समं अत एव द्वयोः न भेदः: there is no difference between the two (Radha and Krishna)
terms.कालमायागुणातीतत्वात्: because they are beyond time and the qualities of Maya (illusion)

meaning: This verse talks about the oneness and non difference between Radha and Krishna, who are considered divine lovers in Hindu mythology. It states that they are one in every aspect - one seat, one intellect, one mind, one knowledge, one soul, one supreme state, one form, and one divine reality. There is no distinction or separation between them. This unity is emphasized by mentioning that they are beyond the influence of time and the illusory qualities of Maya. Therefore, Radha and Krishna are seen as inseparable and representing the ultimate divine union.
